refentry.para: OCSP_cert_to_id, OCSP_cert_id_new, OCSP_CERTID_free, OCSP_id_issuer_cmp, OCSP_id_cmp, OCSP_id_get0_info - OCSP certificate ID utility functions.

refsynopsisdiv.synopsis: int OCSP_id_issuer_cmp(OCSP_CERTID *a, OCSP_CERTID *b); int OCSP_id_cmp(OCSP_CERTID *a, OCSP_CERTID *b);

refsection.title: DESCRIPTION
refsection.para: OCSP_cert_to_id() creates and returns a new OCSP_CERTID structure using message digest dgst for certificate subject with issuer issuer. If dgst is NULL then SHA1 is used.
OCSP_cert_id_new() creates and returns a new OCSP_CERTID using dgst and issuer name issuerName, issuer key hash issuerKey and serial number serialNumber.
OCSP_id_cmp() compares OCSP_CERTID a and b.
OCSP_id_issuer_cmp() compares only the issuer name of OCSP_CERTID a and b.
OCSP_id_get0_info() returns the issuer name hash, hash OID, issuer key hash and serial number contained in cid. If any of the values are not required the corresponding parameter can be set to NULL.

refsection.title: RETURN VALUES
refsection.para: OCSP_cert_to_id() and OCSP_cert_id_new() return either a pointer to a valid OCSP_CERTID structure or NULL if an error occurred.
OCSP_id_cmp() and OCSP_id_issuer_cmp() returns zero for a match and non-zero otherwise.
OCSP_CERTID_free() does not return a value.
OCSP_id_get0_info() returns 1 for sucess and 0 for failure.

refsection.title: NOTES
refsection.para: OCSP clients will typically only use OCSP_cert_to_id() or OCSP_cert_id_new(): the other functions are used by responder applications.
The values returned by OCSP_id_get0_info() are internal pointers and MUST NOT be freed up by an application: they will be freed when the corresponding OCSP_CERTID structure is freed.
